entry.title: The National Health Service (Complaints) Amendment Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend, from 1st September 2006, the National Health Service (Complaints) Regulations 2004 (“the Principal Regulations”), which detail the procedure for the handling of complaints made relating to NHS bodies and prescribe the Healthcare Commission’s role in respect of NHS complaints.

entry.title: The Registered Designs Rules 2006
entry.summary: These Rules are made under the Registered Designs Act 1949 (c. 88). They regulate the business of the Patent Office in relation to designs. These rules replace the Registered Designs Rules 1995 and other Instruments amending those Rules. They make substantial changes to both the drafting and effect of the Registered Designs Rules 1995.

entry.title: The Traffic Signs (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Traffic Signs Regulations and General Directions 2002. Regulation 2(2) and the Schedule insert new diagrams, to indicate quiet lanes in England, into Schedule 4 (miscellaneous informatory signs) to those Regulations. Quiet lanes may be designated by local traffic authorities in England in accordance with the Quiet Lanes and Homes Zones (England) Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/2082). Regulation 2(3) makes a consequential amendment to Schedule 17 (illumination of signs).

entry.title: The Regulatory Reform (Registered Designs) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order is made under section 1 of the Regulatory Reform Act 2001 (c. 6). It amends the Registered Designs Act 1949 (c. 88) (“the 1949 Act”).

entry.title: The Medicines for Human Use (Fees Amendments) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations make further amendments to the Medicines (Products for Human Use—Fees) Regulations 1995 (“the principal Regulations”) and the Medicines (Homoeopathic Medicinal Products for Human Use) Regulations 1994 (“the Homoeopathic Regulations”).

entry.title: The Quiet Lanes and Home Zones (England) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the making, variation and revocation of designations of roads as quiet lanes or home zones under section 268 of the Transport Act 2000 and of use orders and speed orders in respect of those roads.

entry.title: The Vaccine Damage Payments (Specified Disease) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order adds pneumococcal infection to the diseases to which the Vaccine Damage Payments Act 1979 applies.

entry.title: The Terrorism Act 2000 (Proscribed Organisations) (Amendment) Order 2006
entry.summary: Part 2 of the Terrorism Act 2000 makes provision about proscribed organisations (including setting out offences in relation to such organisations in sections 11 to 13). An organisation is proscribed if it is listed in Schedule 2 to that Act or operates under the same name as an organisation so listed (section 3(1)). This Order adds the organisations listed in article 2 to the list in that Schedule.

entry.title: The Environmental Stewardship (England) and Organic Products (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Organic Products Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/1604), which apply throughout the United Kingdom, and the Environmental Stewardship (England) Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/621), which only apply in relation to England.

entry.title: The Export Control (Liberia) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order makes provision in respect of Liberia in consequence of Council Regulation (EC) No. 234/2004 of 10 February 2004 (“the 2004 Regulation”) and Council Regulation (EC) No. 1126/2006 of 24 July 2006 which amends the 2004 Regulation.

entry.title: The Family Proceedings (Amendment) (No. 2) Rules 2006

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES
SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Family Proceedings Rules 1991 (S.I.1991/1247).

entry.title: The Data Protection (Processing of Sensitive Personal Data) Order 2006

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Data Protection (Processing of Sensitive Personal Data) Order 2006

entry.summary: “Sensitive personal data” is defined in section 2(g) and (h) of the Data Protection Act 1998 to include information as to the commission or alleged commission by a person of any offence, or any proceedings for any offence committed or alleged to have been committed by him, the disposal of such proceedings or the sentence of any court in such proceedings.

entry.title: The Health and Personal Social Services (Primary Medical Services) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: These regulations make amendments to The Health and Personal Social Services (General Medical Services Contracts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004 and The Health and Personal Social Services (Primary Medical Services Performers Lists) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004. In particular, it:

entry.title: The European Cooperative Society Regulations 2006
entry.summary: This instrument gives effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 1435/2003 of 22nd July 2003 (on the Statute for a European Cooperative Society (SCE) (O.J. L.207, 18.8.2003 p.1) (the “EC Regulation”) in the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The European Cooperative Society (Involvement of Employees) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Council Directive 2003/72/EC supplementing the Statute for a European Cooperative Society with regard to the involvement of employees. The Directive supplements Regulation 1435/2003/EC.

entry.title: The Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exceptions) (Amendment) (England and Wales) Order 2006

category.term: rehabilitation of offenders, england and wales

entry.summary: This Order amends the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exceptions) Order 1975 (“the 1975 Order”).

entry.title: The Radio Multiplex Services (Required Percentage of Digital Capacity) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order changes from 80 per cent. to 70 per cent. the minimum proportion of the digital capacity on the frequency or frequencies on which a radio multiplex service is broadcast which OFCOM may specify as that which must be used or reserved for certain broadcasting services. The broadcasting services in question are digital sound programme services, simulcast radio services, programme-related services and relevant technical services. The Order applies to both national and local radio multiplex services.

entry.title: The Allocation of Housing and Homelessness (Eligibility) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the provisions of the Allocation of Housing and Homelessness (Eligibility) (England) Regulations 2006(“the Eligibility Regulations”) which determine which persons from abroad, other than persons subject to immigration control, are ineligible for an allocation of housing accommodation under Part 6 of the Housing Act 1996 or for housing assistance under Part 7 of that Act.

entry.title: The City and Hackney Primary Care Trust (Establishment) Amendment Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order amends the Establishment Order of the City and Hackney Primary Care Trust (“the trust”) which was re-named the City and Hackney Teaching Primary Care Trust by S.I. 2003/2663. The trust is a Primary Care Trust established by Order under section 16A of the National Health Service Act 1977. This Order adds to the area for which the trust is established the Inner and Middle Temples.

entry.title: The Excise Duties (Surcharges or Rebates)(Hydrocarbon Oils etc.) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order, which comes into force on 1st September 2006, adjusts the liabilities to excise duty (and, where applicable, the rights to rebate in respect of such duty) in respect of liquid fuels that are chargeable by virtue of the Hydrocarbon Oil Duties Act 1979 (c. 5) (“the Oil Act”). The adjustments made by this Order negate, temporarily, the effect of section 7 of the Finance Act 2006 (c. 25) (“the Finance Act”) in relation to those fuels. The adjustments are all in the form of a deduction from the amount payable (or an addition to the amount of rebate allowable) of a specified percentage not exceeding 10 per cent.
